annual address, entitled, "In The
Name of God, We Will Set Up Our
Banner


We are proud of Miss Doris
Meador, the 1864 Homecoming
Queen of Phoenix Union High
School.


Debonairs are sponsoring
Teen Time Party, Sum-, Oct.
Is. 7 pm. at Pula ski Hall. 42nd
and E. Mcdowell. A Miss Teen
Debonair and a Mr.. Sweetheart
will be named. All proceeds ill
help the underprivileged child
rem Christmas Fund.


Deacon Board of Pilgrim Rest
Baptist Church is sponsoring
building fund program Sum-. Oct.
Is. Seven pastors will present
sermons on The Seven Seals.
Gospel Velvatones have re-
turned from making their guest
appearance in Los Angeles.


AGA Valley Hi affiliate #l0will
hold installation program Mon
day, Oct. 26 at the Valley Life
Bldg.


Thought of the week-Do not
delay the golden moments fly.


-Longfellow


Flora Ruffin 258-00O5

VATICAN CTTY-Pope Paul vi
announced the canonization of %
Uganda martyrs Sunday as the
first African saints of modern
times from the black races.


Native drums took the news
from the villages across equa-
torial Africa, where the %
sainted tribesmen lived and died
in the late 18th century.


The canonization rites we're
accompanied by the beat of new
African oratorio while African
delegates met in St. Peter s Ba-
silica. The saints include a
court jester. herd sman, four
musicians, clothmaker, a dug
out canoe builder and a potter.


Forty two African cardinals
listened as the saints names
we're read and proclaimed as
ascendants into heaven.


For the first time four Negro
prelates were the only ones to
assist the Pope in the mass cele-
bration.


There are an estimated 2 mil
lion African Catholics living in
the eight dioceses of Uganda.

Congratulations to the newly
weds, Mr.. and Mrs. Harry Phil
lips, who both had shows at KCAC.
They spent a short honeymoon in
Las Vegas where theywere mar
ried. Mrs. Moses Woods is the
busy chairman of the second
annual ia shion show sponsored
by the auxiliary of VFW Post
l7l0. Plan to support their eff
forts at Ma sonic Temple, Sum-.
Oct. Is, So pm. A dance will
follow the ia shion show.


Hats off to Jerry Oliver, who
wa named the Student of the
Month at Phoenix Union High.
He was honored at a luncheon
meeting of the Northeast Opti-
mist Club.


Jerry is good student and very
active in the Parma ssus and Bro
therhood Clubs.


enjoyed the thoughts from
Rev. L. ]. Dunbar s sermon,
''We Are Waiting For His Call"
Come out and hear him some
Sunday, or visit your own church.


Salt River Valley Baptist Asso-
citation convention opened Tues,
Oct. 20.


Mrs. E. Allen, senior women

The Harlem Globe Trotters.
the worlds best known and most
travelled basketball team, will
play in the Arizona State Fair
Coliseum the first week in Febru-
ary 1866, announced Emmett
Race, general manager of the
Coliseum. He said the Los

Angeles Lakers professional
basketball team and officials of
the Western Hockey League have
expressed interest in scheduling
events into the Coliseum.


Race said the exact date of the
Globe Trotters appearance has
not been set.

A thankful heart Is not only
the greatest virtue but the parent
Of all the other virtues. Cicero
